13:00.race_name: 17 January Saturday Meeting Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Excellent second at Exeter latest; concedes weight all round but a player after a break
runners.name: Kapitein Kool
runners.spotlight: Narrowly beat Calvino to make a winning start over hurdles at Newton Abbot (2m) in October and built on it with an excellent second of 12 in 2m Exeter novice the following month; concedes weight all round but he's a player after a break.

runners.comment: Only poor form shown in novice hurdles at Chepstow and Wincanton; lots more needed
runners.name: Badentaggart
runners.spotlight: Only poor form shown in bumpers and 2m4f novice hurdles at Chepstow and Wincanton this winter; lots more is required.

runners.comment: Fairly useful ex-Irish hurdler; well below par for new yard at Fontwell so more needed
runners.name: Bright Legend
runners.spotlight: A fairly useful 1m2f Flat winner in Ireland who also showed similar form over hurdles there for Denis Hogan; well below par for his new yard though when third in 2m2f maiden hurdle at Fontwell in October so needs to step forward.

runners.comment: Promising hurdling debut but pulled up at Plumpton since; well worth another chance
runners.name: Calvino
runners.spotlight: Showed fairly useful form when landing a bumper here in April; shaped well when close second to Kapitein Kool on his hurdling debut at Newton Abbot (2m) in October but pulled up in 2m4f Plumpton novice 52 days ago; well worth another chance after a break.

runners.comment: Winning Irish pointer; makes his belated hurdling debut now and the market can guide
runners.name: Fane Court
runners.spotlight: Court Cave gelding; bought for 5,000gns after landing an Irish point in November; makes his belated hurdling debut now and the market can guide.

runners.comment: A fair 1m2f scorer on the Flat for Rod Millman; he's no forlorn hope now going hurdling
runners.name: Forest Hills
runners.spotlight: A fair 1m2f scorer on the Flat but off since posting a below-par fifth at Chepstow in July on his final run for Rod Millman; since changed hands for 15,000gns and he's no forlorn hope now going hurdling.

runners.comment: Promising debut fifth at Chepstow; this winning Irish pointer can build on it; considered
runners.name: Sioux Falls
runners.spotlight: 66-1, made a promising start in this sphere when fifth of 11 in novice at Chepstow (2m, soft) 48 days ago, fading after some late errors; this winning Irish pointer can build on it now and needs considering.

13:30.race_name: 3 February Sporting Clubs Day Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div I)

runners.comment: Ran okay in his first bumper but tailed off in the second and again on hurdling debut
runners.name: Arnie Moon
runners.spotlight: Ran okay in his first bumper but was tailed off in the second and again on hurdling at Exeter (300-1).

runners.comment: Bumper winner; beaten 14l at Hereford but found a maiden here that lacks depth
runners.name: Constantinian
runners.owner: The St George & The Dragon Partnership
runners.spotlight: The horse he beat in a Market Rasen bumper (only three ran) has since won twice over hurdles but this 6yo was put in his place by a surprise winner on his switch to hurdling at Hereford (good); still enters the reckoning in this maiden that lacks depth.

runners.comment: Initial promise but two tailed-off runs over hurdles now leave him with much to prove
runners.name: Hard Stare
runners.spotlight: British point winner and bumper efforts by no means devoid of promise; however, two tailed-off runs over hurdles now leave him with much to prove.

runners.comment: In a good yard but has struggled badly (twice over hurdles) since his encouraging debut
runners.name: Jaffa Cake
runners.spotlight: In a good yard but has struggled badly (twice over hurdles) since his encouraging debut in a bumper; can only be watched.

runners.comment: Looked good in an Irish bumper and positives to take from his two runs in Britain
runners.name: Onlyforfrankie
runners.spotlight: Recorded a very eyecatching RPR when winning his bumper in Ireland (good to yielding) and was then seventh in a Listed bumper at Cheltenham on stable debut; his third at Hereford (2m maiden) was no backward step and he sets the standard here.

runners.comment: Short in the betting but beaten about 12l in bumpers at Leopardstown and Galway
runners.name: Quinta Brigada
runners.spotlight: Beaten about 12l in bumpers at Leopardstown and Galway (both on yielding); was quite short in the market on both occasions and could have a future for new connections.

runners.comment: Had plenty of Flat racing on the continent, going 5-25; should stay the trip okay
runners.name: Trooper
runners.spotlight: Had plenty of Flat racing on the continent, going 5-25; stamina shouldn't be an issue for hurdling and he clearly has plenty of ability; needs checking in the betting.

runners.comment: Tailed off on the AW last month but was runner-up in two bumpers during the summer
runners.name: Victors Spirit
runners.owner: The Ridgeway Racing For Fun Partnership
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in bumpers during the summer but posted modest RPRs and was then tailed off in a 1m4f AW maiden last month; at least found an ordinary race in which to make his hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Point second doesn't amount to much; 50-1 when pulled up here nine days ago
runners.name: Galactic Princess
runners.spotlight: Second of three runners in an Irish maiden point before changing hands for £5,000; 50-1 and pulled up in a 2m3f novice here only nine days ago, having raced too freely; now hooded.

runners.comment: Flat winner in France; flopped at Fontwell but had a break and now tongue tied
runners.name: Babyken
runners.spotlight: First (2m) and second (1m4f) in two Flat runs in France; very disappointing when 7-2 for hurdling debut at Fontwell in October but has had a break since and now tongue tied; remains of interest.

14:00.race_name: 3 February Sporting Clubs Day Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race) (Div II)

runners.comment: Low-grade Flat form in four races at up to 1m2f and he's returning from a long absence
runners.name: Anthracite
runners.spotlight: Low-grade Flat form in four races at up to 1m2f and he's returning from a long absence; best watched.

runners.comment: Bumper winner; let down by jumping when beaten 12l by General Briar last month
runners.name: Crest Of Stars
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who was made favourite for his hurdling debut at Plumpton last month but was let down by his jumping when 12l off the winner; might be wiser for that experience and no surprise should he fare a lot better now.

runners.comment: Made debut in a bumper at Ascot but went off 28-1 and trailed in last
runners.name: Dino Moon
runners.spotlight: Made debut in a bumper at Ascot but went off 28-1 and trailed in last.

runners.comment: Regressed on the Flat and was 150-1 when tailed off on last month's jumps debut here
runners.name: Marhaba Million
runners.spotlight: Regressed on the Flat and was 150-1 when tailed off on last month's jumps debut here.

runners.comment: Looked poor but his 15l defeat behind a good one at Ludlow was very encouraging
runners.name: Monsun Climate
runners.spotlight: 0-5 in points and made a forgettable start under rules, but it was a likeable run when staying on for a 15l fifth at Ludlow behind a novice with good form last month; he'll need more again but he's one to keep an eye on for sure.

runners.comment: Competitive in points but tailed off and pulled up in her two runs over hurdles; opposable
runners.name: Bees Kiss
runners.spotlight: Competitive in points but tailed off and pulled up in her two runs over hurdles; opposable.

runners.comment: Beaten a shade under 20l in two C&D novices this winter so she has a degree of ability
runners.name: Lydeard Girl
runners.spotlight: Beaten a shade under 20l in two C&D novices this winter so she has a degree of ability; still rates an unlikely winner of this.

runners.comment: Useful on the Flat; clear at one stage before going down by 12l at Newbury
runners.name: Explode
runners.spotlight: Useful middle-distance performer for James Ferguson; made a disappointing start over hurdles at Catterick but showed a lot more at Newbury (joint favourite), for all that he could have been flattered after holding a clear lead at one point; if ridden the same way then this sharper track should benefit.

runners.comment: Second to the smart Macktoad at Sandown and this is an easier assignment
runners.name: Pourquoi Pas Papa
runners.spotlight: Bought for 200,000euros after finishing second in a French hurdle and again found one too good on British debut at Sandown (soft) in the shape of Macktoad, who could still be smart despite disappointing next time in a Grade 2; this 4yo could take some beating.

runners.comment: Placed on the Flat for James Owen but at a modest level; stamina not guaranteed
runners.name: Ill Give It A Go
runners.spotlight: Placed on the Flat for James Owen but at a modest level and, with stamina not guaranteed for jumping, she makes limited appeal.

14:30.race_name: 12 February Valentines Meeting Novices' Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Remains winless over fences and only seventh at Ludlow latest; sort to bounce back though
runners.name: Hypotenus
runners.spotlight: Remains winless over fences and he failed to build on a good reappearance second when only seventh in 2m Ludlow handicap chase 22 days ago; he's the sort to bounce back though.

runners.comment: Overcame some mistakes to score at Leicester 29 days ago; has more to offer so big shout
runners.name: Irish Chorus
runners.spotlight: Fair maiden hurdler who has quickly advanced her form in this sphere, overcoming some mistakes to bag 2m Leicester handicap 29 days ago; up 2lb but she has more to offer and merits serious consideration.

runners.comment: Arrives in good nick without winning over fences; ought to be thereabouts again eased 1lb
runners.name: Juggernaut
runners.spotlight: Arrives in good nick without winning over fences, badly impeded three out when fourth of eight in 2m Wincanton handicap in November; ought to be thereabouts once more eased 1lb.

runners.comment: Failed to fire in a couple of runs for his current yard, pulled up at Ffos Las latest
runners.name: Ballybeen
runners.spotlight: Yet to register a victory and has failed to fire in a couple of runs for his current yard, pulled up in 2m3f Ffos Las handicap chase 50 days ago; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Off 14 months before beating one on yard debut at Ludlow latest; bit to prove now chasing
runners.name: OGradys Hill
runners.spotlight: A fair maiden hurdler for Harry Derham but she was off for 14 months before beating just one in 2m Ludlow handicap last month; a point winner but she has a bit to prove now going chasing.

runners.comment: Pulled up on his chasing debut at Exeter three weeks ago; he's not easy to make a case for
runners.name: Senor Diaz
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on his chasing debut in 2m3f Exeter handicap three weeks ago; he's not easy to make a case for in his bid for a maiden victory.

runners.comment: Beaten with no penalty at Fontwell two months ago and he's now 7lb higher
runners.name: Brave Knight
runners.spotlight: Enhanced his good strike-rate over hurdles when a 15l winner under Freddie Keighley at Fontwell (2m1f, good to soft) but couldn't make the most of escaping a penalty when a 7l third back there over 2m3f; now 7lb higher, so there are questions to be answered after two months off.

runners.comment: Has his off days but knows how to win races and he's on a competitive mark
runners.name: Bluegrass
runners.spotlight: Has his off days, as has been the case in two of his last three starts; but he's 5-20 over hurdles and runner-up on four other occasions, so off a realistic mark he can't be ruled out.

runners.comment: Has won over 3m so latest second over 2m3f at Taunton can be viewed positively
runners.name: American Sniper
runners.spotlight: Can be hard to predict but he's on a handy mark with Rian Corcoran claiming 7lb and he had a good day last time here when finishing second to Celtic Art over this trip (good), especially for one who stays 3m.

runners.comment: 3l too good for American Sniper here last time; up 6lb but big shout if in the same form
runners.name: Celtic Art
runners.spotlight: Similar profile to Bluegrass in that he can be hit and miss but is capable on his day, as he showed when 3l superior to American Sniper over C&D four weeks ago (good); a danger to all if in the same form, even off a 6lb higher mark.

runners.comment: Second run after a wind op when winning at Huntingdon; visor on for blinkers
runners.name: Benvoy
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent but it was his second run back from wind surgery and the blinkers were back on when a length winner at Huntingdon (2m, good to soft; 3lb lower); whether he'll be as good again remains to be seen and the visor is new.

runners.comment: Beaten by an 11yo on handicap debut and that was at 3m; he's improving, though
runners.name: Breezethroughlife
runners.spotlight: Only his second run over hurdles and first for this yard when winning a maiden at Fakenham (2m4f, good); tailed off under a penalty next time but bounced back with a rallying second on his handicap debut at Doncaster (good to soft); that was over 3m and the winner was an exposed 11yo, but he's heading in the right direction.

runners.comment: Fair handicap debut at Sandown but this stiffer stamina test might not benefit
runners.name: Fight My Fire
runners.spotlight: Flat-bred 5yo who won a maiden hurdle at Fontwell (2m1f, good to soft) and ran better again to be fourth (beaten 6.5l) on handicap debut at Sandown (2m, soft); did weaken late on that day and will need to see out this longer trip, though the forecast drier ground can help in that respect.

runners.comment: Out of form in the autumn but back on better ground here with cheekpieces added
runners.name: Time Interval
runners.spotlight: Made all on consecutive outings last spring, latterly off today's mark at Warwick (2m, good); returned from break with three down-the-field runs in the autumn but combination of better ground and new headgear may prompt something better.

runners.comment: Kept on to be under 5l behind Celtic Art over C&D last month; considered each-way
runners.name: Him Malaya
runners.spotlight: Hasn't had all that much racing since his last win 13 months ago and kept on to be under 5l behind Celtic Art over C&D last month; off the same mark so needs more, but one to consider each-way.

runners.breeder: E A R L Haras De Mandore
runners.comment: It's been a quiet return back with former yard and he has a strike-rate of just 3-43
runners.name: Zhang Fei
runners.spotlight: Should have run better in a claimer on his first run back with this yard and again well held returned to handicap company at Kempton; not the easiest to win with at the best of times (3-43).

15:30.race_name: Geoffrey Bosley 'Tally Ho' Open Hunters' Chase

runners.comment: Useful chaser in his prime but in poor form over hurdles when last seen in early 2025
runners.name: Guy
runners.spotlight: Useful handicapper chaser in his prime for Nigel Twiston-Davies but in poor form over hurdles when last seen in early part of last year; revival needed on stable/hunter chase debut; seems best on good/good to soft ground.

runners.comment: Won four times on good ground for Olly Murphy in spring/summer; rain a big worry here
runners.name: Stumps Or Slips
runners.spotlight: Won four in a row (2m4f-2m5f; three handicap chases and a novice hurdle) on good ground for Olly Murphy last spring/summer; changed hands for £26,000 after close second in small-field novice hurdle in the autumn; forecast rain a big worry before this hunter chase debut.

runners.comment: Very useful handicapper; pulled up last time; hard to beat here if back on song
runners.name: Unexpected Party
runners.spotlight: Very useful handicapper who won Grand Annual Chase at 2024 Cheltenham Festival (2m, soft) and was second in that race last year (good to soft); disappointed on latest outing one month ago but should be fine stamina-wise on this hunter chase debut and will be very hard to beat at this level if anywhere near his best.

runners.comment: Honourable fifth in last season's Aintree Foxhunters' and won open point in November
runners.name: A Jet Of Our Own
runners.spotlight: In good form in hunter chases last spring, most notably when honourable fifth over the big Aintree fences (2m5f, good to soft), and returned from break with open point win at Larkhill (good) in November; will be suited by the forecast rain here and has a big role to play.

runners.breeder: Mickley Stud D McCain & D & F Lockwood
runners.comment: Won a handicap chase last season and his pointing debut in November was respectable
runners.name: Just Loose Change
runners.spotlight: Won novices' handicap chase at Huntingdon (2m7f, good) for Nicky Martin last season; left that stable after some lesser efforts but his pointing debut in November was respectable and he's not ruled out each-way.

runners.comment: Ended 2025 with two point wins but has a lot more on his plate on this rules debut
runners.name: Dorset Dazzler
runners.spotlight: Won maiden point in today's headgear combination at Larkhill in November, his 21st attempt, and followed up in restricted event over same C&D (also on good) in December; seems to have turned a corner but has a lot more on his plate on this rules debut.

runners.comment: Ended 2025 with two good point runs but still makes only limited appeal on rules debut
runners.name: Dorset Diamond
runners.spotlight: 1-26 in points, the win gained on soft ground at Badbury Rings in February 2024; seemingly aided by tongue-tie when ending 2025 with two good efforts at Larkhill but still makes only limited appeal on rules debut.

runners.comment: Very useful in his prime but both hunter chase runs last season were underwhelming
runners.name: Fan De Blues
runners.spotlight: Very useful when trained in Ireland by Willie Mullins but returned from two-year absence with two underwhelming hunter chase runs for new stable last spring and has been off again since; had wind op in December.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten in two Larkhill points towards end of 2025; first rules run since 2021
runners.name: Finisher
runners.spotlight: Won a small-field point in the autumn but was soundly beaten in two Larkhill opens towards end of last year (behind Dorset Diamond on latter occasion) and faces a tough assignment on first start under rules since 2021; tongue-tie refitted.

16:00.race_name: 9 March Dragonbet Festival Fever Mares' Handicap Hurdle

runners.breeder: V & F Berouards Haras Des Sablonnets &
runners.comment: Won on British debut in September but subsequent form has been disappointing
runners.name: Best Night
runners.spotlight: Won Newton Abbot novice (2m1f, good to soft) on British debut in September but was safely held in two Exeter handicaps (2m/2m2f) towards end of last year and comes here with quite a bit to prove.

runners.comment: Scored on good ground in October and last month's soft-ground third was also a good effort
runners.name: Getmetothemoon
runners.spotlight: Showed career-best form when scoring at Stratford (2m, good) in October and put a lesser effort behind her when creditable third at Wincanton (2m4f, soft) last month; can make her presence felt again.

runners.comment: Ran poorly on handicap debut but her first two hurdle runs were quite promising
runners.name: Getarose
runners.spotlight: Ran very poorly on last month's C&D handicap debut but there was significant promise in her first two hurdle runs (2m/2m3f) and she remains very unexposed; unraced on anything other than good ground.

runners.comment: Placed in big field last month, her second run after a long layoff; still on good mark
runners.name: East End Girl
runners.spotlight: Ran well to a point at Ludlow (2m, good) in November, after a long absence, and was third of 15 at Hereford (2m, soft) last month; still well handicapped on old form and features prominently in calculations.

runners.comment: Began this season in good form but may find 2m a bit sharp and doesn't want rain
runners.name: Broomfield Gale
runners.spotlight: Began this season in good form on good ground, most notably when winning by 11l at Stratford (2m6f); had soft ground as an excuse for last month's low-key reappearance run but conditions might turn against her again here and today's trip is probably shorter than ideal.

runners.comment: Dual good-ground winner last spring; contender if there's not too much rain about
runners.name: Bluenose Belle
runners.spotlight: Came good with two good-ground wins last spring (2m1f/2m) and returned from break with battling second (no match for winner) at Ludlow (2m, good) in November; contender if there's not too much rain about.

runners.comment: Won on stable debut in September but very little has gone to plan since; headgear switched
runners.name: Ruler Of The River
runners.spotlight: Scored at Plumpton (2m4f, good) on stable debut in September but very little has gone to plan since; ought to have coped better with the soft ground when pulled up at Leicester (2m4f; first run after wind op) 11 days ago; drops back in trip and swaps cheekpieces for first-time visor here.

runners.comment: Ran quite well over 2m3f here in November but others have more pressing claims
runners.name: Jukebox Annie
runners.spotlight: Ran quite well when sixth of 13 here (2m3f, good to firm) in November but has generally found things tough in handicaps since winning small-field C&D novice (good to firm) in autumn 2024; unraced on ground slower than good to soft.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten in two slow-ground handicaps this season and now 0-5
runners.name: LInoubliable
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in two slow-ground handicaps this season (2m2f/2m; cheekpieces added last time); still unexposed after only five starts and could plausibly be seen to better effect if the ground is quicker here but others have much more obvious claims.

17:30.race_name: £99 Annual Pass Restricted Maiden Stakes (For horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 0-11; placed nine times; in the mix if at the top of his game after four months off
runners.name: Gennadius
runners.spotlight: Frustrating sort who is 0-11 and has been placed nine times (including on Polytrack elsewhere); however, his form reads well in today's context and he can be in the mix if at the top of his game after four months off.

runners.comment: Unable to threaten when fifth on both starts (including C&D); improvement is necessary
runners.name: Special Acclaim
runners.spotlight: Unable to threaten when fifth on both starts (including C&D); loose before the start and withdrawn at Lingfield last month (12-1 at the time); improvement is necessary.

runners.comment: Kept on for close fourth over 5f on debut and could take a big step forward now at 6f
runners.name: Evenepoel
runners.spotlight: 14-1, slowly away and outpaced before keeping on for close fourth of eight on last month's debut at Lingfield (5f, Polytrack); this half-brother to two winners could take a big step forward now up in trip; high on the list.

runners.comment: Hasn't shown enough to suggest he's the one to be on; makes debut for another new yard
runners.name: Roccobear
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far when last of four on debut at Newcastle (6f, AW; for Richard Fahey) in October but down the field over this C&D later that month (for Charlie Wallis); gelded since and with another new yard; others preferred.

runners.comment: Went close at Wolverhampton on second start & raced wide there next time; one to consider
runners.name: Arishkas Dream
runners.spotlight: Hint of promise on debut over C&D in October then went close at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta); raced wide when only fourth there (5f) last time and he's one to consider today.

runners.comment: Showed pace when third over 7f on debut and could be involved now dropped to 6f
runners.name: Rawson
runners.spotlight: 10-1, showed pace when 12l third of nine behind easy Godolphin winner on debut at Southwell (7f, Tapeta) four weeks ago; the drop in trip could suit and he could be involved for his in-form yard.

runners.comment: 65,000euros breeze-up buy; 3rd of five on debut; could show the benefit of that experience
runners.name: Sparksmith
runners.spotlight: 18-1 and beaten just over 5l when third of five on last month's debut at Lingfield (6f, Polytrack); however, he could show the benefit of that experience today and this 65,000euros breeze-up buy is not ruled out.

runners.comment: Short-headed at Kempton on second start and in good hands to continue to progress
runners.name: Allegrino
runners.spotlight: Left November's debut (6f, Tapeta) well behind when short-headed at 33-1 at Kempton (6f, Polytrack) later that month; she has a useful pedigree and is in good hands to continue to progress; firmly in calculations.

runners.comment: Has shown ability but 0-5 and this exposed filly may again be vulnerable
runners.name: Havana Jag
runners.owner: Hold My Beer D Cunha M Broughton
runners.spotlight: She's made the frame on four of her five starts, most recently fourth of ten on handicap debut at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta); however, she's exposed and may again be vulnerable on this first outing on Polytrack.

runners.comment: Return to 6f could help on this third start but others have more substance to their claims
runners.name: In Denial
runners.spotlight: Small step forward at Wolverhampton (5f, Tapeta) last month on second start, when keeping on for fifth of ten; the return to 6f could help but others have more substance to their claims.

runners.comment: Half-sister to six winners but pedigree hints this Twilight Son newcomer may want further
runners.name: Nautical Sky
runners.spotlight: 11th foal; half-sister to six winners including Harbour Beacon (10.6f AW; RPR 89), Fantastic Blue (11.4f/1m4f; 88), Like No Other (7f AW; 85) and Asian Wing (10.6f-2m including AW; 81); dam placed 6f-9.4f AW (61); pedigree hints this Twilight Son newcomer may want further.

runners.comment: Makes debut in what looks an ordinary contest and with her yard in flying form; respected
runners.name: Preferred
runners.spotlight: Third foal; Masar half-sister to 5f turf 2yo/6f AW winner Byefornow (RPR 66); dam 6f winner (81) from very talented family; makes debut in what looks an ordinary contest and with her stable in flying form; respected, especially if strong in the betting.

18:00.race_name: Curry And Racing Next Thursday Classified Stakes

runners.comment: Tenth of 12 after 18 months off at Wolverhampton 33 days ago; needs major step forward
runners.name: Dequinto
runners.spotlight: Came in only tenth of 12 after 18 months off in 6f Wolverhampton handicap 33 days ago and is now 0-18; needs to take a major step forward.

runners.comment: Remains winless but back on track with Wolverhampton second this week; enters calculation
runners.name: Dubai Magic
runners.spotlight: Remains winless but she got back on track in refitted cheekpieces when second of nine in 5f classified event at Wolverhampton six days ago; she must enter calculations with headgear again sported.

runners.comment: Scored at Wolverhampton (5f) in August but comes here below par; more is needed
runners.name: Flickas Girl
runners.spotlight: Scored at Wolverhampton (5f) in August but comes here below par, albeit not best drawn when beating only one in 6f Lingfield handicap 17 days ago; more is needed.

runners.comment: Third for new yard at Wolverhampton 17 days ago; form franked since; leading claims
runners.name: Isla Bella
runners.spotlight: A modest 6f scorer for George Boughey who shaped encouragingly on her third start for current yard when third of eight in 5f Wolverhampton handicap 17 days ago; that form has been franked so she holds leading claims.

runners.comment: Failed to beat a rival in 5f Lingfield handicap 24 days ago; easy to look elsewhere
runners.name: Kamberleigh
runners.spotlight: Poor maiden who was gelded before failing to beat a rival in 5f Lingfield handicap 24 days ago; easy to look elsewhere.

runners.comment: On a long losing run and she beat just two in 7f Lingfield handicap 17 days ago; visor on
runners.name: Little Miss Magic
runners.spotlight: On a long losing run and she beat just two in 7f Lingfield handicap 17 days ago; visor is reached for now.

runners.comment: Resumed winning ways at Brighton (5.2f) in June but largely well below par since
runners.name: Lynwood Lad
runners.spotlight: Resumed winning ways at Brighton (5.2f) in June but largely well below par since, tenth of 12 in handicap over that C&D in September; much more is required after a break.

runners.comment: It's now 20 starts since his sole success at Newcastle; others appeal more
runners.name: Magic Fluke
runners.spotlight: It's now 20 starts since his sole success at Newcastle (6f) and he was well held when 11th in 7f handicap in refitted headgear here in October; others appeal more.

runners.comment: Course winner but she comes here under a cloud; not easy to make a case for
runners.name: Mammy
runners.spotlight: Course winner but she comes here under a cloud, eighth of 11 in 6f Lingfield handicap 17 days ago; she's not easy to make a case for.

runners.comment: Hinted at a revival when fifth on Tapeta last month; likely player for yard among winners
runners.name: My Genghis
runners.spotlight: A dual 5f/6f scorer in 2024 who hinted at a revival when fifth of 11 in 5f Wolverhampton handicap last month; a likely player for yard among the winners.

runners.comment: Course scorer; back to form when third in handicap over C&D in October; not ruled out
runners.name: Poetic Jack
runners.spotlight: Course scorer who returned to form when third of six in handicap over C&D in October; not ruled out at these weights after a break.

runners.comment: Ended run of poor efforts with good Lingfield second 17 days ago; needs to back it up now
runners.name: World Of Darcy
runners.spotlight: A three-time 6f winner in 2024 who ended a run of poor efforts with a good second of 11 in 6f Lingfield handicap 17 days ago; he needs to back it up now.

runners.comment: 0-27 in handicaps, but beaten a neck at Lingfield last time; shouldn't be far away again
runners.name: Roman Emperor
runners.spotlight: 0-27 in handicaps, but has gone close a few times as when beaten a neck at Lingfield (7f, Polytrack) 17 days ago; no problem with the return to 6f and shouldn't be far away again.

runners.comment: All five wins over 6f on the AW; well drawn and another big run seems likely
runners.name: Smasher
runners.spotlight: All five wins over 6f on the AW and just 1lb higher than for the latest at Kempton in October; well drawn and another big run seems likely.

runners.comment: Front-runner who has become favourably treated, but is 0-28 on the AW; others preferred
runners.name: Dion Baker
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who is 11lb lower than when second of six over C&D in March last year, but is 0-28 on the AW; others preferred.

runners.comment: Second to a subsequent winner at Kempton last month; a repeat would give her every chance
runners.name: Analytical Engine
runners.spotlight: Won at Yarmouth (6f, good to firm) in August and bounced back to form when second of ten at Kempton (6f, Polytack) last month (winner has gone in again since); not proving very consistent, but a repeat of that latest effort would give her every chance from the inside stall.

runners.comment: 4lb below his last winning mark, but last few efforts not amongst his best; no headgear
runners.name: Sir Rodneyredblood
runners.spotlight: Grand old campaigner who has won 16 of his 105 starts, eight of them around here; often likes to force it and has dropped 4lb below his last winning mark, but last few efforts not amongst his best; no headgear today.

runners.comment: 0-13 and no improvement since switched to handicaps
runners.name: Genius Mistake
runners.spotlight: 0-13 and no improvement since switched to handicaps, including at Wolverhampton on Tuesday.

runners.comment: 6lb lower than when winning at Brighton last May, but with good reason; needs a revival
runners.name: Port Hedland
runners.spotlight: Ran some fair races on Tapeta last spring and has dropped 6lb lower than when winning at Brighton (5.2f, good to firm) in May, but with good reason; needs a revival; stable also runs Daley T.

runners.breeder: D & S L Tanker Transport Ltd
runners.comment: Just 3-62 but finished runner-up at Wolverhampton on Tuesday; shortlisted
runners.name: Tommytwohoots
runners.spotlight: Record of 3-62 suggests he is usually worth taking on, but he ran well on his second start back with this yard when second of seven at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) on Tuesday; shortlisted.

runners.comment: Well held on his return from a mammoth absence last month; now 0-16 and best watched
runners.name: Daley T
runners.spotlight: Some fair form in defeat as a 3yo, but well held on his return from a mammoth absence at Wolverhampton last month and is now 0-16; probably best watched for now.

runners.comment: Has only once been placed in 15 starts on the AW; drop in class one ray of hope
runners.name: Haliphon
runners.spotlight: Mark continues to fall, but he's not getting any closer to winning and has only once been placed in 15 starts on the AW; dropping into a 0-55 for the first time one ray of hope.

runners.comment: Won over C&D in August and may have needed the run last month; player if bouncing back
runners.name: Arenas Del Tiempo
runners.owner: D Edmonston T Helliwell & S J Holden
runners.spotlight: Sole win in 22 AW starts came over C&D in August; may have needed her return from 95 days off when held at Lingfield (1m5f, Polytrack) last month and a player if bouncing back.

runners.comment: Sliding down the weights but unplaced in nine starts for this yard; needs a resurgence
runners.name: Hedonista
runners.spotlight: More than 20lb lower than when twice runner-up on the AW around this time last year, but has been unplaced in all nine starts for this yard; needs a resurgence on this second start since a second wind op.

runners.comment: Modest since finishing third in an Exeter bumper in October; cheekpieces on
runners.name: Power Quest
runners.spotlight: Modest since finishing third of seven on his debut in an Exeter bumper in October; needs this longer trip and return of headgear to make a difference.

runners.comment: Fourth over C&D in November was one of his better recent efforts, but he is now 0-21
runners.name: Bloodhound
runners.spotlight: Fourth of 13 over C&D in November was one of his better recent efforts, but that race was slowly run and he is now 0-21; look elsewhere.

runners.comment: 1lb lower than when winning over 1m6f here last April; respected
runners.name: Smokey Malone
runners.spotlight: Undone by a lack of pace when fifth of 13 on his return from four months off over C&D in November (just under 2l behind Bloodhound), but has dropped 1lb lower than when winning over 1m6f here last April; respected.

runners.comment: Second at Wolverhampton last month and had a possible excuse last time, but is 0-18
runners.name: Damzon
runners.spotlight: Best recent effort when second of 11 at Wolverhampton (2m, Tapeta) last month and would have preferred a stronger gallop back there 16 days later, but a record of 0-18 doesn't make her appealing.

runners.comment: 0-18 but nearly made all at Wolverhampton in September and may again get his own way
runners.name: Lumberjack
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who is 0-18, but he nearly pulled off a 50-1 shock when beaten a head at Wolverhampton (1m6f, Tapeta) in September having been left to do his own thing in front; possible a similar scenario may play out here so he can't be dismissed entirely.

runners.comment: Lightly raced and little to get excited about in six starts; blinkers on
runners.name: Filligris
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced and little to get excited about in six starts; will need to be transformed by the blinkers.

runners.comment: Has hinted at a little ability; longer trip should suit on breeding
runners.name: Nora Barnacle
runners.spotlight: Out of the frame in six starts, though did hint at ability when sixth of 12 at Wolverhampton (9.5f, Tapeta; first-time hood, now removed) last month; needs more, but the longer trip should suit on breeding; a possible.

19:30.race_name: Cosy Dining In The Fairwood Handicap

runners.comment: Five-time AW winner who returns from a break with his yard in good form; not ruled out
runners.name: Lequinto
runners.spotlight: Five-time AW winner who scored four times on turf last June-September; it's possible this 9yo will need this first outing since a below-par run in September but he's not ruled out with his yard in good form.

runners.comment: Some good form at Southwell at the end of last year and he could be in the mix
runners.name: Mumayaz
runners.spotlight: Won at Southwell (6f, Tapeta) in November and not helped by slow start when third there (7f) last time; also effective on Polytrack and he went close the last time he tackled 5f; he could be in the mix.

runners.comment: Won two in a row over C&D in the autumn and he's entitled to respect now back down in trip
runners.name: General Assembly
runners.spotlight: Won two in a row over C&D in the autumn; better could have been expected over 6f here on his last two starts but he's nevertheless entitled to respect now back down to his optimum distance.

runners.comment: In good form in the autumn but merely sixth on last two starts and needs to raise her game
runners.name: Fiorella Princess
runners.spotlight: In good form for Lemos De Souza in the autumn, including a runner-up finish here, but she's been merely sixth on her first two starts for this yard and needs to raise her game.

runners.comment: Beaten just a neck in this race last year and ran well here last Friday; strong contender
runners.name: Merrimack
runners.spotlight: 0-11 on AW but beaten just a neck in this race last year and he ran well when third over 6f here last Friday, shaping as though he would benefit from the drop back in trip; strong contender for in-form stable.

runners.comment: One win from his 16 starts but runner-up in last three races and could be bang there
runners.name: Speed Of Maajid
runners.spotlight: Just one win from his 16 starts and beaten on his last 12 outings, but he's finished runner-up in his last three races (5f, Tapeta); has also run well over this C&D and could be bang there once more.

runners.comment: Won off 1lb higher over C&D last March but not in the same form more recently
runners.name: Diamond Dreamer
runners.spotlight: He's 1lb lower than when winning over C&D last March but has been well below his best on his five starts since September; others preferred.

runners.comment: Could give another good account but the drop back to 5f isn't an obvious plus
runners.name: Neptune Legend
runners.spotlight: Won at Wolverhampton (6f, Tapeta) on third stable start and not beaten far when fifth on next two outings (6f, including Polytrack); could give another good account but the drop back to 5f isn't an obvious plus.

runners.comment: 11yo who is winless since 2020 but showed spark at Kempton two starts ago; not written off
runners.name: Plantadream
runners.owner: H J Jarvis & Mrs P Jarvis
runners.spotlight: 11yo who was inconsistent in 2025 and couldn't get into it at Kempton (1m, Polytrack) last time, while he's winless since 2020; however, he showed spark at Kempton (1m) two starts ago and is not written off today.

runners.comment: Off the mark in C&D novice last month and in calculations now back in a handicap
runners.name: Champagne Powder
runners.owner: S Jones P Burrell & P F I Cole Ltd
runners.spotlight: Headstrong sort who got off the mark at the eighth attempt when making all in second-time blinkers (retained) in a C&D novice last month; the runner-up has won since and he's in calculations now back in a handicap.

runners.comment: Step back in right direction on recent stable debut and in the mix if backing that up
runners.name: Nordic Norm
runners.spotlight: Became disappointing after winning on debut for Karl Burke (1m, Tapeta) but took a step back in the right direction with 2l fourth of six on recent yard debut at Lingfield (1m, Polytrack); in the mix if backing that up.

runners.comment: Poor strike-rate but arrives in good form and there's every chance he'll play leading role
runners.name: High On Hope
runners.spotlight: Sole win (from 17 attempts) came in a two-runner turf maiden (7.4f) in August; however, he's been in good heart in Tapeta handicaps (1m/7f) on his last two runs; every chance he'll play a leading role; Polytrack debut.

runners.comment: Mark continues to tumble and one to watch in the betting, but 2025 turned into a struggle
runners.name: Under The Sun
runners.spotlight: His mark continues to tumble and he's one to watch in the betting, but 2025 turned into a struggle (Flat/hurdles); major revival required.

20:30.race_name: Hire Exclusive Spaces For Unforgettable Events Handicap

runners.comment: Won by a nose at Wolverhampton a fortnight ago and could have more to offer for James Owen
runners.name: Silkies Sib
runners.spotlight: Sent off favourite when winning very narrowly at Wolverhampton (9.4f, Tapeta) a fortnight ago on his third start for James Owen; back up 2lb he remains on a good mark on his old Irish form and could have more to offer for this yard; wears first-time cheekpieces.

runners.comment: 0-10 but ran well on last three starts and every chance she'll be in the mix
runners.name: Beachborough Girl
runners.spotlight: 0-10 for Alice Haynes (who has ceased training) but ran well on final three starts for that yard (including C&D) and new stable had a winner at Wolverhampton recently; there's every chance she'll be in the mix.

runners.comment: 0-11 but promising fourth on stable debut and one to consider on the back of that
runners.name: Pure Theory
runners.spotlight: Remains a maiden after 11 starts but she was a promising fourth at Lingfield (1m2f, Polytrack; 33-1) last month when making her stable debut after three months off; she's one to consider on the back of that.

runners.comment: 11-race maiden but running okay of late and has an each-way shout in a first-time visor
runners.name: Noss Mayo
runners.spotlight: 11-race maiden but she's run okay to finish fifth/fourth on Tapeta on her last three starts (9.4f-1m4f); each-way shout in a first-time visor.

runners.comment: Stable form is a positive and he's very lightly raced, but beaten a long way last time
runners.name: Saint Terry
runners.spotlight: Stable form is a positive and this very lightly raced 5yo is one to watch in the betting on his second handicap start, but he was beaten a long way at 40-1 at Lingfield (1m, Polytrack) three weeks ago after a break.

runners.comment: Merely sixth at Lingfield last time and now 0-22; needs something extra
runners.name: Trackman
runners.spotlight: He produced one of his best runs for a while when sixth of 13 at Lingfield (1m2f, Polytrack) last month but never posed a serious threat; now 0-22.

runners.comment: Runner-up in Lingfield classified (1m2f, turf) in June but slim pickings since
runners.name: Mond
runners.spotlight: Runner-up in Lingfield classified (1m2f, turf) in June but slim pickings since and others make greater appeal.

runners.comment: Claims are far from obvious but he's caught the eye staying on well in 7f races here
runners.name: Shades Of May
runners.spotlight: 13-race maiden whose claims are far from obvious judged on the bare form of his handicap performances since last May; however, on two separate occasions in that time he caught the eye staying on well over 7f here, and this first venture beyond 1m is an interesting move.

runners.comment: 21-race maiden who finished down the field on her two runs at Lingfield last month
runners.name: Mount Of Gold
runners.spotlight: 21-race maiden who finished down the field on her two runs at Lingfield (1m5f/1m2f, Polytrack) last month and she's hard to fancy.

12:40.race_name: BOG On British Racing At DragonBet Novices' Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Battled gamely for huge-odds win at Exeter last month; contender under penalty here
runners.name: Blowers
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on last month's rules debut but became the longest-priced winner in British racing history when battling gamely to cause 300-1 shock at Exeter (2m, heavy; front pair clear) 12 days later; ought to play another big role under his penalty here.

runners.comment: Won course bumper here last March and 2m4f maiden hurdle here in October; respected
runners.name: Starzand
runners.spotlight: Impressed in good-ground course bumper on rules debut last March and justified favouritism in 2m4f maiden hurdle here (soft) in October; may not be ideally suited by this drop back in trip but probably still has a lot more to offer.

runners.comment: Placed in strong Warwick maiden on hurdle debut and has strong claims here
runners.name: Bossman Jack
runners.owner: M W Lake & Exors Of The Late N W Lake
runners.spotlight: Half-brother to smart jumper Gidleigh Park; won readily on last season's bumper debut and was placed in a strong Warwick maiden hurdle (2m, also good to soft) when reappearing in November; will be a tough nut to crack if he copes with the slower ground here.

runners.comment: Well beaten when 80-1 for Hereford bumper in November 2024 and not seen since
runners.name: Commander Teddy
runners.spotlight: Well beaten when 80-1 for Hereford bumper in November 2024 and not seen since.

runners.comment: Showed clear promise in two Chepstow bumpers in early 2025; has a future over hurdles
runners.name: Emerald Breeze
runners.spotlight: Out of an unraced sister to high-class jumper Ollie Magern; displayed significant promise when fourth in two Chepstow bumpers (heavy/good) in early 2025; can do well over hurdles but has good standard to reach here.

runners.comment: Always behind when 40-1 for good-ground Hereford bumper in November
runners.name: Sun And Rain
runners.spotlight: Out of a half-sister to top-class jumper Allaho; always behind when 40-1 for good-ground Hereford bumper in November; can only be watched on hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Soundly beaten on both hurdling starts and can't be recommended here
runners.name: Half Pint Daisy
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten on both hurdling starts and can't be recommended here.

runners.comment: Made quite encouraging debut last month but is probably one for further down the line
runners.name: Man Maid
runners.spotlight: First foal from a fair 2m5f hurdle/3m2f chase winner; made quite encouraging debut when seventh of 18 at Wincanton (1m7f, soft) last month but is probably one for a bit further down the line.

runners.comment: Well down the field at huge odds in two soft-ground hurdles in the autumn
runners.name: Rest Is The Best
runners.spotlight: Well down the field at huge odds in two soft-ground hurdles in the autumn.

runners.comment: Made low-key rules debut in good-ground Worcester bumper last spring
runners.name: Silver Gale
runners.spotlight: Placed in a fast-ground point bumper last April but made low-key rules debut in good-ground Worcester bumper the following month.

runners.comment: Cost £30,000 after slow-ground Irish point win; makes rules debut after one-year absence
runners.name: Spring Serenade
runners.spotlight: From a good jumping family and was bought for £30,000 after winning by 10l on Irish point debut a year ago (soft to heavy); faces tough task on this rules debut but worth keeping an eye on with the future in mind.

13:10.race_name: Watch All UK Racing On DragonBet Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Modest on the Flat and pulled up at 200-1 on last month's hurdle and stable debut
runners.name: Big Lou
runners.spotlight: Modest on the Flat and pulled up at 200-1 on last month's hurdle and stable debut at Hereford (2m, good to soft).

runners.comment: Runner-up on all four starts and he can give another good account; chance
runners.name: Bobbys Nelson
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on all four starts, in a point, bumper and two novice hurdles (2m, soft; including here); there's every chance he'll be suited by this step up in trip and he can give another good account; chance.

runners.comment: Pulled up/tailed off on his two starts and modest handicaps beckon
runners.name: Eaststone Bucks
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on debut last March (2m2f, good to soft; 16-1) and tailed off at Leicester (1m7f, soft; 40-1) last time; modest handicaps beckon.

runners.comment: Bumper winner; turned over at 2-5 on hurdle debut but still ran well; respected
runners.name: Giantsgrave
runners.spotlight: Point runner (3m, soft to heavy) who made a winning bumper debut here (2m, soft) last January; turned over at 2-5 in maiden hurdle at Lingfield (2m3f, good to soft) in November but still ran well to finish a close third of six and he's in good hands to progress; respected.

runners.breeder: E A R L De La Cauvelliere
runners.comment: Point winner; somewhat underwhelming on hurdle but could be a different proposition today
runners.name: Jackpot Cauveliere
runners.spotlight: Bought for £100,000 after 20l win in his sole Irish point (3m, soft); somewhat underwhelming when 7-2 for hurdle debut at Warwick (2m5f, soft) in November but no surprise if he's a different proposition today.

runners.comment: Point winner whose C&D hurdle debut fourth gives him something to build; each-way shout
runners.name: Jurys In
runners.spotlight: Irish maiden point winner (3m, soft) who was picked up for £65,000 and again showed promise when fourth over C&D (soft) in October on hurdle debut; open to improvement and could be an each-way contender.

runners.breeder: E U R L Agb Agency & Mrs D Billebaut
runners.comment: Point winner and bumper runner-up, but disappointing on hurdle debut in November
runners.name: Karma Police
runners.spotlight: Point winner who was short-headed on bumper debut at Fontwell (2m1f, soft) last January; weak in the betting when tailed off in novice hurdle at Leicester (2m4f, soft) in November; a market check is advised (one of two for respected stable) but he has something to prove after last time.

runners.breeder: Scea De La Sapiniere & A Chaille-Chaill
runners.comment: Point winner but tailed off at triple-figure odds on his three hurdle starts
runners.name: Manhattan Valley
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the fourth attempt in points in May 2024; however, tailed off at triple-figure odds on his three hurdle starts and he'll probably be of far greater interest when tackling handicaps.

runners.comment: 0-10 under rules but runner-up four times and this could be a good opportunity
runners.name: Off The Jury
runners.spotlight: Point winner who is yet to get the job done under rules after ten attempts; however, he's been runner-up four times, most recently in a maiden hurdle at Ascot (2m5f, soft), and this could be a good opportunity.

runners.comment: Point winner but big prices and pulled up/soundly beaten on his two hurdle starts
runners.name: The Moonlight Man
runners.spotlight: Won Irish maiden point (3m, soft to heavy) last January on second start but sent off big prices for his first two hurdle runs and has been pulled up/soundly beaten; others are preferred.

runners.comment: 11l 2nd at Chepstow in a race that lacked depth; a place is probably the best to hope for
runners.name: Times Are Green
runners.spotlight: He's raced five times and produced his best performance yet when 11l second of eight at Chepstow (2m7f, good to soft) last month; however, that race lacked depth and another placing is probably the best to hope for.

runners.breeder: Mrs Catherine Bodin & Mr Joel Bodin
runners.comment: Point runner-up in April 2024 but tailed off over hurdles last month after long absence
runners.name: Tom Desjy
runners.spotlight: Runner-up on debut in Irish maiden point (3m, good) in April 2024 then sold for £52,000; however, after a long absence he was tailed off at 8-1 in a maiden hurdle at Huntingdon (2m4f, soft) last month; may be best watched.

runners.comment: Has shown ability and this longer trip may suit but a sizeable step forward is needed
runners.name: Trade War
runners.spotlight: He's shown ability here on his first two starts (2m, heavy/soft; bumper/novice hurdle) and his useful pedigree suggests this longer trip may suit, but a sizeable step forward is needed today.

13:40.race_name: DragonBet Best Odds Guaranteed UK Racing Novices' Limited Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.breeder: R D & Mrs J S Chugg
runners.comment: Left Gordon Elliott after two disappointing hurdle runs; now chasing for new stable
runners.name: Pour Les Filles
runners.spotlight: 1-6 over hurdles for Gordon Elliott in Ireland; sold for £9,500 after two disappointing runs in the autumn and now switches to fences for new stable; needs to have been revitalised by his new regime.

runners.comment: 2-2 over hurdles; battled well to score on chase debut; still has considerable potential
runners.name: Juby Ball
runners.spotlight: 2-2 over hurdles last season; had to battle hard to justify skinny odds on seasonal/chase debut at Carlisle (2m, soft; four fences omitted) in November but moves up in trip here and could still have considerable potential.

runners.comment: Unexposed 6yo; not beaten far in small-field beginners' chase last month; handicap debut
runners.name: Largy Belter
runners.spotlight: Joined Dan Skelton after promising Irish bumper debut at start of 2025; soundly beaten in hot beginners' chases on first two starts for new stable this autumn but his close third in a small field at Haydock (2m4f, soft) in December was encouraging and he's open to improvement in handicaps.

runners.comment: 3-12 over hurdles in France; makes British/chase debut after long absence; blinkers added
runners.name: Alentejo
runners.owner: Mr And Mrs J D Cotton
runners.spotlight: 3-12 over hurdles when trained in France; out of form when last seen in 2024 and very tricky to weigh up before this chasing debut but has joined a top stable for his career in Britain; had wind op last summer; sports first-time blinkers; market may guide.

14:10.race_name: Stream All British Racing On DragonBet Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: A faller over fences on last 2 starts; on a dangerous mark; possible player back hurdling
runners.name: Lemoncello
runners.spotlight: Tailed off over hurdles on final two runs last season and he's been a faller over fences on his two outings this term; however, there was some promise in those recent performances and he's on a dangerous mark; possible player now back over hurdles.

runners.comment: C&D winner who scored at Leicester 39 days ago; in the mix if backing up that effort
runners.name: Fresh Speculation
runners.spotlight: Won over C&D (soft) in November 2024 and back on the scoresheet at Leicester (2m4f, soft) 39 days ago; he has an in-and-out profile but did it nicely last time and can be in the mix up 7lb if backing up that effort.

runners.comment: Showed ability on first 2 hurdle starts (including C&D); improvement needed on h'cap debut
runners.name: Aaron
runners.spotlight: Ex-French Flat performer who showed ability on his first two hurdle starts (including C&D on soft) and the good to soft ground and/or the 2m7f trip may not have suited when pulled up last time; however, improvement is necessary if he's to defy his opening mark.

runners.comment: Bumper/maiden hurdle winner for whom the step up in trip could be ideal on handicap debut
runners.name: There Runs Mary
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner (1m7f, heavy) who scored easily here (2m, soft) on her hurdle debut in November; beaten favourite at Leicester (1m7f, soft) 11 days later but still ran pretty well and the step up in trip could be ideal on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Open to improvement and Harry Atkins removes a useful 7lb on handicap debut; chance
runners.name: Hot Goddess
runners.spotlight: Made the frame on all three hurdle starts (2m-2m5f, soft/good to soft), most recently at Lingfield last month after an absence; open to improvement and Harry Atkins removes a useful 7lb on handicap debut; chance.

runners.comment: 10yo who has career-high mark but beat 13 rivals to win at Wincanton latest; respected
runners.name: Our Dylan
runners.spotlight: Returned to form on his second start of the season to win at Wincanton (2m4f, good) in November; has also won on soft; this 10yo is up 5lb to a career-high mark but beat 13 rivals last time and is entitled to respect.

runners.comment: Returns from long absence but new trainer is enjoying an excellent season; watch betting
runners.name: Bluella Bresil
runners.spotlight: Two-time bumper runner-up who was a close third for Ben Pauling in maiden hurdle at Lingfield (2m3f, soft) in February 2024; absent since lesser run that March (wind op in interim) but new trainer is enjoying an excellent season; interesting on comeback, especially if strong in the betting.

runners.comment: Didn't jump well over fences last time (pulled up) and not ruled out now back over hurdles
runners.name: Pachacuti
runners.spotlight: Inconsistent and pulled up over fences at Wetherby last month, but didn't jump well and prior to that he was third in a chase here (3m, soft); has won over hurdles and not ruled out now back over hurdles with a first-time visor replacing cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Taunton last week was a step back in the right direction but he needs another today
runners.name: I Am Spider Man
runners.spotlight: His recent sixth of nine at Taunton was a step back in the right direction on his second start back from an absence, but this 9yo needs to build on that performance if he's to make an impact this afternoon.

runners.comment: Soft-ground course winner who reappeared with 22-1 second of 16 at Taunton four weeks ago
runners.name: Colonial Empire
runners.spotlight: His form went the wrong way last season but he reappeared with a 22-1 second of 16 at Taunton (3m, good) four weeks ago; has won here on soft ground and he can be bang there if producing another good run today.

runners.comment: Runner-up to a handicap blot at Chepstow in November and he's in calculations
runners.name: Mumbles
runners.spotlight: Having dropped down the weights he returned to form when second to a handicap blot at Chepstow (2m, soft) in November; back up 4lb he remains well treated on his old form and should be fine at this trip; in calculations.

14:40.race_name: DragonBet BOG On All British Racing Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Close third in tactical race at Ludlow last month; remains on a workable mark; big player
runners.name: Hunter Legend
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far in major handicap at Cheltenham (2m4f, soft) in November and bounced back from a lesser effort when close third in tactical race at Ludlow (3m, good to soft) last month; still on a workable mark and still unexposed over 3m; high on the list.

runners.breeder: Mrs S M Newell & T F Lacey
runners.comment: Three hurdle wins last season; bled from the nose and was pulled up on last two outings
runners.name: Strackan
runners.spotlight: Won three in a row over hurdles last season (2m4f-3m, soft) but was pulled up after bleeding from nose on last two appearances, the latter his seasonal/chase debut in November; could still have a good future over fences but comes with obvious risk attached.

runners.comment: Won comfortably by 7l on last month's seasonal/chase debut; makes obvious appeal
runners.name: Itseemslikeit
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 7yo who showed the benefit of his latest wind operation when winning comfortably by 7l on last month's seasonal/chase debut at Uttoxeter (3m, heavy); 7lb higher here but could easily have more to offer.

runners.comment: Ran well here last season but returns here with quite a bit to prove
runners.name: Hurricane Highway
runners.spotlight: Returned from layoff with clear second behind Karuma Grey here (2m5f, heavy) in December 2024 but disappointed on both subsequent outings last season (chase/hurdle) and weakened quickly on reappearance outing in November (hurdles); needs to get career back on track.

runners.comment: Shock course winner for another stable last season but subsequent form has been poor
runners.name: Karuma Grey
runners.spotlight: Caused 100-1 shock here (2m5f, heavy) on debut for Alison Thorpe in December 2024 but his subsequent form for that yard was poor and he was pulled up on seasonal/stable debut in November; tried in first-time cheekpieces today; can't be supported with any confidence.

runners.comment: Didn't run badly in 3m6f Exeter marathon last month; this drop back in trip will suit
runners.name: Astronomic View
runners.spotlight: Had modest strike-rate over hurdles and is 0-4 over fences but didn't run badly when third (albeit well held) in 3m6f Exeter marathon last month and this drop back in trip is probably the right move.

runners.comment: Absent since Hexham second last May but returns on good mark and with conditions suitable
runners.name: Not Sure
runners.spotlight: Below best form during light campaign last season and absent since second at Hexham (3m, good) last May but returns on a good mark and with trip/ground suitable; contender if fully tuned up.

runners.comment: Placed over C&D two runs ago but far too inconsistent to rely upon nowadays
runners.name: Stellar Stream
runners.spotlight: Thorough stayer who bettered his low-key seasonal debut when clear third over C&D (soft) in November; pulled up on latest outing, though, and has become far too inconsistent to rely upon; 4lb out of the handicap; swaps cheekpieces for refitted blinkers.

15:10.race_name: DragonBet Backing British Racing Novices' Limited Handicap Hurdle

runners.breeder: Paul Lafitte Mme Marie Lafitte & Mme
runners.comment: Clear second at Ffos Las on British debut; modest effort since but may do better still
runners.name: Pipas Lescribaa
runners.spotlight: Flat winner in France and clear second in Ffos Las maiden hurdle (2m, soft) on British debut; modest plugging-on fifth in Uttoxeter handicap (2m4f) since but has low mileage and may do better still.

runners.comment: Positive signs in handicaps this term, rallying second at Market Rasen latest; in the mix
runners.name: Welcheston Warrier
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden; has shown positive signs in a couple of 2m4f handicaps this season, rallying second at Market Rasen (good to soft) latest; possibilities with this return to 2m6f well worth exploring.

runners.comment: Only a modest third last time (handicap debut) and needs to find improvement
runners.name: Osterberg
runners.spotlight: Seven-race maiden whose form claims aren't particularly solid; only a modest third at Uttoxeter (2m4f, heavy; handicap debut) most recently and needs some improvement to get off the mark.

runners.comment: Attracted support last time (handicap debut) and is evidently thought capable of better
runners.name: Bombay Pete
runners.spotlight: Never landed a blow in Class 4 event at Aintree (3m; handicap debut) most recently but attracted support and is evidently thought capable of better; may take a step forward dropped in grade.

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Haras Des Marais
runners.comment: Broadly consistent, mostly at Ffos Las, since switched to handicaps; frame possibilities
runners.name: Leech
runners.spotlight: Heavy-ground bumper winner; broadly consistent over hurdles, mostly at Ffos Las, since switched to handicaps (2m/2m4f); again has frame possibilities, provided he stays this new trip.

runners.comment: Somewhat knocking on the door, having finished second in two chases this season
runners.name: Nedzor
runners.spotlight: Maiden who is somewhat knocking on the door, having finished second in soft-ground handicap chases at Ffos Las (2m) and Uttoxeter (2m4f) this term; likely player, provided he's in similar form back over hurdles.

runners.comment: Made all at Leicester last time; may take some pegging back with Sean Bowen on board
runners.name: Lady Henrietta
runners.spotlight: Dictated the pace and stuck on well under conditional rider at Leicester (2m4f, heavy) last time, opening her account at the 15th attempt; may prove hard to peg back with Sean Bowen on board, provided she gets another easy lead.

runners.comment: Point/chase winner; enough to prove back over hurdles in first-time headgear
runners.name: Benny Baloo
runners.spotlight: Point/chase winner whose form has dipped in two starts, both over fences, this season for new yard; hurdles record is far from convincing; enough to prove in first-time headgear.

runners.comment: Posted a resurgent effort in first-time blinkers most recently; could go well
runners.name: Dance In The Park
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden who posted a resurgent effort in first-time blinkers at Catterick (2m3f; second start for new stable) most recently; dropped a further 3lb and could go well in the retained headgear.

runners.comment: Still a maiden at the age of nine but is competitively weighted on best hurdles form
runners.name: Ginderella
runners.spotlight: Showed signs of retaining ability last time (3m) when making chase debut and back from lengthy absence; still a maiden at the age of nine but is competitively treated on best hurdles form.

15:40.race_name: Bet And Stream British At DragonBet Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Needs to prove as effective back down in trip but can't be dismissed in current form
runners.name: Getaway With You
runners.spotlight: Record of 21112 (over 2m3f/2m4f) since wearing a tongue-tie and cheekpieces together; has shot up the weights and needs to prove as effective back down in trip but can't be dismissed in current form.

runners.comment: Resurgent effort in first-time cheekpieces at Windsor most recently; possibilities
runners.name: El Gavilan
runners.spotlight: 12-race maiden who posted a resurgent effort in first-time cheekpieces at Windsor (2m, good) most recently, finishing second; has form on softer ground; possibilities in the retained headgear.

runners.comment: Far from solid on his results for new stable but is very well treated on best form
runners.name: Copper Cove
runners.spotlight: Attractively treated, having gained sole hurdles win off 8lb higher; far from solid on his 2m4f results (P4P) at Worcester for new stable but this change of scenario may have positive effect.

runners.comment: Did well over hurdles in 2024 but achieved nothing returned to this code last time
runners.name: Daany
runners.owner: Duckhaven D Kenealy W Sprigg M Sprigg
runners.spotlight: Scored four times over hurdles in 2024 but achieved nothing when belatedly returned to this code last time (below best on Flat in the interim); brings a doubt over current form.

runners.comment: Has regressed elsewhere in last three outings but the return to this C&D looks a plus
runners.name: Gavin
runners.spotlight: Gained last three wins over C&D, all on good ground, the most recent early in a busy current campaign; has regressed elsewhere in last three outings but may stage a turnaround off a workable mark back here.

runners.comment: Rallying second at Leicester last time; nearly a stone below opening mark; in the mix
runners.name: Out Of Focus
runners.spotlight: Good-ground bumper scorer who has made the frame plenty of times over hurdles, rallying second at Leicester (1m7f, soft) most recently; nearly a stone below his opening mark; fighting chance.

runners.comment: On a handy mark but seems to be out of sorts and still has a poor strike-rate
runners.name: Port Or Starboard
runners.spotlight: On a handy mark and has plenty of Ffos Las form but seems to be out of sorts and still has a poor strike-rate; hence brings an equal amount of positives and negatives.

runners.comment: Ran encouragingly at Taunton (second start for new yard) last time; one to consider
runners.name: Man Oh Man
runners.spotlight: Ex-Irish maiden who ran encouragingly at Taunton (2m3f, good to firm; second start for new yard) most recently, achieving his first piece of placed form; may build on that effort; one to consider.

runners.comment: Pulled up on last three starts, capable off this mark but hard to fancy for now
runners.name: Toofareastiswest
runners.spotlight: Pulled up on final two starts of last season and similar outcome on return to action at Tramore a week ago when 80-1; capable off this mark but hard to fancy for now.

runners.comment: Up 7lb and up in grade for Naas chase debut win last month, could be more to come
runners.name: The Big Cloud
runners.spotlight: Hurdles winner got off the mark at the first attempt over fences on seasonal reappearance in a 0-100 at Naas last month (2m, heavy); up 7lb and higher grade now but could be more to come.

runners.comment: Four-time chase winner, 14lb below last win, trip ok but never won on ground this testing
runners.name: Lake Chad
runners.spotlight: Four-time chase winner (three at Tramore) is 14lb below his last win and he has run well here before; improved effort on latest at Tramore (21.5f, soft) and this trip fine but yet to win on ground this testing.

runners.comment: Good ground hurdles winner, pulled up on heavy latest, ground a worry again here
runners.name: Quinn The Eskimo
runners.spotlight: Good ground hurdles winner shaped with mild promise on chase debut in a beginners' at Thurles (18.5f, gd-yld); pulled up on heavy on handicap chase debut at Naas; ground a worry again here.

runners.comment: Two-time hurdles winner, pulled up or tailed off last five starts, revival needed
runners.name: Knockbrack Rambler
runners.spotlight: Two-time winner over timber lost his way last year; pulled up or tailed off on last five starts; needs a revival.

runners.comment: Struggled on first chase start for over a year latest, this trip suits, can't discount
runners.name: Halsafari
runners.owner: John P Bowe & Michael J Bowe
runners.spotlight: 13yo gained first win for almost six years in a 2m Cork handicap hurdle in November; struggled on first chase start for over a year at Limerick (22.5f, sft-hvy) latest; dropped 5lb and this trip more suitable so can't discount.

runners.comment: 0-4 over fences but has run well in defeat, runner up latest, go well again off 3lb higher
runners.name: Kilbrin Rocco
runners.spotlight: Winning hurdler is 0-4 over fences but has run well in defeat; 1.25l runner up on latest at Limerick (17.5f, sft-hvy); raised 3lb but should continue to give a good account.

runners.comment: Pulled up on return to chasing at Limerick 13 days ago, place claims on run here in Nov'
runners.name: Doyen Magic
runners.spotlight: Closely matched with Kilbrin Rocco on their meeting here in November; since won a mares' handicap hurdle at Limerick (2m, heavy) but pulled up on return to chasing 13 days ago; place claims if bouncing back.

runners.comment: 0-6 over fences, placed on penultimate but pulled up latest (22.5f), drop in trip a plus
runners.name: Love Like This
runners.spotlight: Long-standing maiden is 0-6 over fences but has placed on a couple of occasions, including when a 6.75l third behind The Big Cloud at Naas last month (2m, heavy); pulled up at Thurles since (25.5f, yielding), however; drop back in trip a plus.

runners.comment: Veteran, behind a couple of these here last November, beaten over timber twice since
runners.name: Added Bonus
runners.spotlight: Veteran a two-time chase winner at Thurles; behind a couple of today's opponents when eighth here in November; beaten over hurdles twice since; others make more appeal.

runners.comment: Modest form when placed in first two points, pulled up latest, likely best watched
runners.name: Daytime Friend
runners.spotlight: Modest form when placed in two of three point-to-points but pulled up in that sphere when last seen in November; best watched in first hunter chase.

runners.comment: Winning pointer, beaten a head in this race on heavy in 2024, could go well
runners.name: Dromleigh
runners.spotlight: Sole win in point-to-points in February 2023; beaten a head in this race in 2024 on heavy ground; runner up in three of last four starts in point-to-points; could go well.

runners.comment: Pulled up in four of six starts, beaten 15l in point on latest, hard to fancy
runners.name: Hey Sir
runners.spotlight: Pulled up in four of six starts including in sole hunter chase start at Punchestown in May; beaten 15l in a point-to-point latest; hard to make a case for.

runners.comment: Won at Tinahely in Nov', unseated at Limerick latest, place chance on best form
runners.name: Long Road
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the ninth attempt in point-to-points at Tinahely in November; leading when unseating at the sixth in a Limerick hunter chase latest; runner up in Tramore hunter chase in May; place chance on best form.

runners.comment: Kildorrery win has worked out, in poor form in hunter chases since, more needed
runners.name: Made U Look
runners.spotlight: Took the scalp of recent maiden hurdle winner Rebel Budz when scoring at Kildorrery in March; no impact in four hunter chases since then and beaten 31l when fourth at Limerick on latest; more needed.

runners.breeder: P Fisher W Fisher & C Austin
runners.comment: 7-15 in points, won last three in that sphere, second in this last year, obvious chance
runners.name: Magic Sadler
runners.spotlight: Prolific pointer (7-15) has won his last three starts in that sphere; beaten 3.25l when runner up in this race last year on yielding to soft; has won a point-to-point on heavy; obvious chance.

runners.comment: Point winner on good, promise in maiden hurdles, might prefer quicker ground than this
runners.name: Mister Loolah
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner in May 2025 (good); not bad efforts in two of last three runs in maiden hurdles but might prefer quicker ground than this.

runners.comment: 4-7 in points, fine run at Down Royal latest, pulled up sole previous start on soft
runners.name: My Life Be Like
runners.spotlight: 4-7 in point-to-points; fine effort on second start in this sphere when a 2.5l fourth of 16 at Down Royal (3m, gd-yld) last month; pulled up only previous start on soft though so ground a big worry here.

runners.comment: Two-time point winner, 0-6 over fences, beaten 21l in hunter chase latest, needs more
runners.name: Nibbles
runners.spotlight: Two-time point-to-point winner; 0-6 in chases under Rules' and rated 98; beaten 21l when third of 14 in a maiden hunter chase at Limerick latest; improvement needed.

runners.comment: No point win since March 2023, poor since runner up at Gowran last March, others preferred
runners.name: Step Up Son
runners.spotlight: 10yo on long losing run since second point-to-point win in March 2023; 100-1 when a 6.5l runner up in a Gowran hunter chase last March; four poor runs since and beaten 21l in a point-to-point latest; others preferred.

runners.comment: Modest maiden hurdle form, placed in points the last twice, this  shorter trip could suit
runners.name: The Happy Huntsman
runners.spotlight: Modest form in maiden hurdles last year; runner up in 3m point-to-points at Dromahane the last twice, not quite getting home; this shorter trip could suit and could run well at a price.

runners.comment: Won at Ballingarry in May, has joined champion trainer, unproven on testing ground
runners.name: I Walked The Line
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the fourth attempt in point-to-points for Cormac Doyle at Ballingarry (3m, good) in May; has since joined the champion trainer and of obvious interest in first hunter chase, though lacks a run and unproven on testing ground.

runners.comment: 5-13 in points, pulled up sole previous hunter chase and in point latest, bit to prove
runners.name: Hathaways Cottage
runners.spotlight: Decent strike rate in point-to-points (5-13); pulled up on sole previous Rules' start in a Limerick hunter chase and again pulled up on return from a break in a point-to-point latest; a bit to prove for now.

runners.comment: The choice of Townend following runner-up finish at Punchestown last time; big chance
runners.name: Charlus
runners.spotlight: One of two for trainer; some fine runs in defeat on the Flat last summer; won a Naas maiden over this trip on heavy last season before a poor run in the Triumph Hurdle; Townend retains the faith since finishing a runner-up behind a longer priced stablemate at Punchestown in December (2m, heavy); big chance.

runners.breeder: E A R L Guittet Desbois
runners.comment: Bumper/hurdle winner has looked out of form in recent Flat and hurdles runs
runners.name: Icare Desbois
runners.spotlight: Bumper and maiden hurdle winner when trained by Willie Mullins; no closer than 8l in three Flat maidens for current yard; returned to hurdles at Leopardstown over Christmas when 26l behind (2m, yielding); blinkers are now added to the tongue-tie, but out of form at the moment.

runners.comment: C&D maiden hurdle winner in 2024 has a lot to find on ratings
runners.name: Marlpark
runners.spotlight: C&D maiden hurdle win here in October 2024 (2m, good to yielding); ran a decent race in a handicap hurdle last month when fifth; pulled up on chasing debut last time when plagued by jumping errors; a lot to find on ratings.

runners.breeder: M Alban Chevalier Du Fau & M Emmanuel Chevalier Du Fau
runners.comment: Debut bumper winner kept on well to win over 2m3f last time; drop back in trip a concern
runners.name: Santo Sospir
runners.spotlight: Scored on debut in a six-runner heavy ground Punchestown bumper in February; well beaten on hurdling debut at Wexford, but appeared to benefit from step up in trip when winning a Punchestown maiden hurdle by 1l last time (2m3f, soft to heavy); drop back in trip not sure to suit him.

runners.comment: Dual bumper winner in 2023 was tailed off at Punchestown on return, which raises questions
runners.name: Baby Kate
runners.spotlight: One of two for trainer; dual bumper winner in 2023, including a Listed Cheltenham event; won a Naas maiden hurdle on comeback last season but was then disappointing in a Fairyhouse Grade 3; returned from 302 days off in a Punchestown Listed mares' hurdle in a first-time tongue-tie where she didn't jump with fluency and finished tailed off; tongue-tie left off now but latest run raises questions and needs career best.

runners.comment: Flat winner, soundly beaten on hurdles debut at Limerick, hard to fancy after that effort
runners.name: Ina Mina
runners.spotlight: Flat winner struggled on hurdles debut at Limerick 12 days ago when 66-1; drops in trip but hard to fancy on that effort.

runners.comment: Bumper winner, bred to make a hurdler, talented rider claims 7lb, go well
runners.name: Shadys Lady
runners.spotlight: Off the mark at the third attempt in bumpers at Naas (2m, sft-hvy) in November; pedigree suggests she'll make a hurdler and could go well with promising claimer taking off a handy 7lb.

runners.comment: Course Flat winner, rated 117 after 3 runs over timber, strip fitter for latest, chance
runners.name: Shoda
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat winner (including a 2m win here) rated 117 after three thirds over hurdles; beaten 10l behind Ballyfad at Leopardstown's Christmas meeting after a 106 day break; strip fitter now; chance.

runners.comment: Well bred but 0-5 in bumpers, well beaten on hurdles debut, others preferred
runners.name: Apples Jane
runners.spotlight: Very well bred but 0-5 in bumpers and jumping lacked fluency when well beaten on hurdling debut at Fairyhouse when last seen in October; others preferred.
