runners.comment: 0-2 in bumpers, 200-1 and tailed off on hurdles debut, others more likely
runners.name: Ballinaboola Gold
runners.spotlight: 0-2 in bumpers and tailed off when 200-1 for hurdles debut at Naas last month; others more likely.

runners.comment: Placed in sole point, heavy defeats both starts over hurdles, one for handicaps
runners.name: Ballingurteen
runners.spotlight: Placed in sole start in point-to-points last March; heavy defeats both starts in maiden hurdles; may do better when tackling handicaps.

runners.comment: 0-6 in points, huge odds and ran accordingly in two maiden hurdles, safe to rule out
runners.name: Barrowline
runners.spotlight: 0-6 in point-to-points; triple-figure odds for both starts over hurdles and ran accordingly; seems safe to rule out.

runners.comment: Midfield on debut in Thurles bumper last month, may need more time, watch
runners.name: Baymount
runners.spotlight: 12-1 and weakened into midfield on debut in a Thurles bumper last month; may need more time and probably best watched on hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Glimmer of ability on hurdles debut at Punchestown, much more needed
runners.name: Boston Breeze
runners.spotlight: Showed a glimmer of ability when sixth of 8 on debut in a Punchestown maiden hurdle (2m, heavy); much more needed to be competitive here.

runners.comment: Solid third at Punchestown on hurdles debut, unseated latest, claims
runners.name: Crystal Gold
runners.spotlight: Placed in sole start in point-to-points; 10.5l third on hurdles debut at Punchestown (19.5f, sft-hvy); unseated just after the fifth in first-time hood (retained) at Limerick on latest when 9-2; solid chance on that Punchestown effort.

runners.comment: No impact in a pair of 2m maiden hurdles at Thurles, handicaps beckon
runners.name: Del Boys Diva
runners.spotlight: Long odds and no impact in a pair of 2m maiden hurdles at Thurles; handicaps likely beckon after this.

runners.comment: Tailed off in maiden hurdles at Cork and Thurles, unlikely to be the answer here
runners.name: Down Your Way
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in maiden hurdles at Cork and Thurles 13 days apart last month; unlikely to be the answer here.

runners.comment: Point winner, made no impression in first two maiden hurdles, may find level in h'caps
runners.name: Hilltop Duchess
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner in good hands but has made no impression in her first two tries in maiden hurdles; may find her level in handicaps.

runners.comment: E20,000 Hillstar mare, dam chase and hurdles winner, likely best watched on debut
runners.name: Jumbos Jet
runners.spotlight: Hillstar mare; E20,000 foal; dam 2m chase/2m2f hurdle winner, closely related to useful 2m3f/2m5f hurdle winner Storm Goddess, out of 2m/2m3f hurdle winning half-sister to smart 2m-2m5f hurdle winner Younevercall; bred to have a future but likely best watched on debut.

runners.comment: Placed in 4yo maidens, well beaten off 102 in h'cap latest, more needed back in a maiden
runners.name: Likealightswitch
runners.spotlight: Placed three times in 4yo maiden hurdles; well beaten off 102 in a handicap hurdle at Cork on latest; needs to improve plenty to get her head in front back in maiden company.

runners.comment: Huge odds and never sighted in two maiden hurdles, hard to fancy on form
runners.name: Madam Elle
runners.spotlight: Huge odds and never sighted in maiden hurdles at Cork and Limerick; hard to fancy on those efforts.

runners.comment: Westerner mare, half-sister to two Rules' winners, likely best watched on debut
runners.name: Question Asked
runners.spotlight: Westerner mare; half-sister to winners Lara Trot (2m4f hurdle), Born In Borris (2m hurdle) and Star Of Honour (point); dam unraced half-sister to Ballyholland (smart 2m-2m6f hurdle/chase); debutante likely best watched.

runners.breeder: G Durrheim And Maria Mulcahy Durrheim
runners.comment: Point winner, promising third on hurdles debut at Naas, likely to improve, leading claims
runners.name: Radiator Springs
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner for champion handler Colin Bowe; outran odds of 40-1 when a promising third of 19 on hurdling debut at Naas (2m, sft-hvy) last month (11l behind top bumper performer Bambino Fever); likely to improve and she has leading claims.

runners.comment: Not beaten far in third point but tailed off at 150-1 at Limerick last time; unlikely
runners.name: Bohemian Bay
runners.spotlight: Not beaten far in third point start before making rules debut at Limerick (soft to heavy) last month, when tailed off at 150-1; unlikely.

runners.comment: Failed to complete two points and same story on rules debut; ruled out
runners.name: Boston Fire
runners.spotlight: Failed to complete opening two point-to-points and same story on rules debut at Naas; impossible to fancy.

runners.comment: Point winner has been tailed off in three starts under rules and neglected by Townend
runners.name: Drop A Threat
runners.spotlight: One of three for yard; 100,000euros store purchase; winner of point-to-point debut by 12l but hasn't flourished in three starts under rules to date, tailed off in all; neglected by Townend.

runners.comment: Decent yard debut before tailed off latest, but the choice of Townend so respected
runners.name: Gorvitho
runners.spotlight: One of three for yard; distant third of 20 on yard debut at Tipperary in November but was tailed off when odds on for a subsequent maiden hurdle at that venue (reportedly blowing hard post race); appears to be stable first-string so entitled to a lot of respect.

runners.breeder: S C E A Ecurie Pierre Julienne
runners.comment: PU in opening point before runner-up in April; Townend rides another on stable/rules bow
runners.name: King Of Aces
runners.spotlight: One of three for yard; pulled up in point-to-point debut before taking the runner-up spot last time for trainer Aidan Fitzgerald; makes debut now for top trainer, but Townend rides another

runners.comment: Moderate bumper debut before tailed off at Listowel and no improvement over hurdles latest
runners.name: Larkfield Liberty
runners.spotlight: Best effort came on bumper debut when a 22l sixth at Bellewstown; last of 15 in a Listowel bumper next time and no improvement on hurdling debut last time.

runners.comment: Tailed off after starting with a price of 150-1 at Punchestown last month; ruled out
runners.name: Masons Apron
runners.spotlight: Tailed off after starting with a price of 150-1 at Punchestown last month; ruled out.

runners.comment: 56-rated Flat maiden was a remote tenth on hurdling debut last time
runners.name: Max Meridius
runners.spotlight: 56-rated Flat maiden; ended his Flat campaign with a creditable fifth of 25 in a 1m2f Curragh handicap (heavy); remote tenth on hurdling debut at Fairyhouse.

runners.comment: Faller in a point when weakening makes rules debut now and others more likely
runners.name: Patton
runners.spotlight: Dropped to seventh when falling in a Dromahane point-to-point in April; makes rules debut now and others more likely.

runners.breeder: S C E A Des Prairies M Benoit Jeffroy & M Thomas Jeffroy
runners.comment: Point winner was probably not seen to best effect in a bumper; could make presence felt
runners.name: Speculateur
runners.spotlight: Point winner for champion handler Colin Bowe; probably not seen to best effect in a bumper; could make his presence felt now, with stable in brilliant form.

runners.comment: Runner-up in third point start latest; best watched on rules debut
runners.name: Thewaybackhome
runners.spotlight: Best of three point-to-point starts came last time at Curraghmore when a 2l runner-up; probably best watched for rules debut.

runners.comment: Ran well when runner-up here in Dec' 2024; needs more based on three recent outings
runners.name: Whatsanotheryear
runners.spotlight: Best of five maiden hurdle runs came here in December 2024 when a 5l second (2m3f, yielding); needs more based on three runs late last year.

runners.comment: 200-1 when pulled up at Cork on debut; hard to fancy
runners.name: Wings Of Zeus
runners.spotlight: One of two for trainer; 200-1 when pulled up at Cork on debut; hard to fancy.

runners.comment: Went close on bumper debut and decent hurdles run in Aug'; tailed off when last seen
runners.name: Crystabel
runners.owner: M R D Fleming & G Bruce & J P Ryan & Miss G Ryan
runners.spotlight: Beaten a head on bumper debut for Andrew Balding; had place claims going to the last on second hurdles start at Killarney in August when falling at the last; tailed off at Sligo when last seen; has never run on ground slower than yielding; tongue-tie on now.

runners.comment: Tailed off on debut at Limerick on heavy ground; best watched for now
runners.name: Sycamore Cove
runners.spotlight: One of two for trainer; tailed off on debut at Limerick on heavy ground; best watched for now.

runners.comment: Point winner in Nov' has backed that up with two good placed finishes under rules
runners.name: Gino Bella
runners.spotlight: Won a Dromahane point-to-point for Barry Fitzgerald in November; backed that up with a good third at Thurles next time (2m, good to yielding), and the winner of that race won again subsequently; another solid effort upped to 2m4f at Fairyhouse last month when a distant second behind a rival who had finished behind her at Thurles; should be thereabouts on just eighth start under rules, with rider taking off 5lb.

runners.comment: 78-rated Flat winner has made little impression in three hurdle runs; others preferred
runners.name: Global Skies
runners.spotlight: 78-rated Flat winner in Britain; made little impression in opening two runs over hurdles for new yard and well beaten in only British hurdles start as well last season; others preferred unless supported on handicap bow.

runners.comment: Tailed off in opening three m'dens and best watched unless market speaks
runners.name: Humble Brag
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in opening three maidens; trainer has noted him to be "a very nervous animal"; makes handicap debut now but best watched unless market speaks.

runners.comment: M'den hurdle winner in 2023 before long absence; okay run in April but tailed off latest
runners.name: Our Uncle Jack
runners.spotlight: Won a Tramore maiden hurdle in October 2023 (2m, heavy); best effort since return from a long layoff came at Kilbeggan in April when a 12l fifth of 14 (2m2f, good to yielding); tailed off when last seen back at Kilbeggan in June and another layoff to overcome now.

runners.comment: H'cap winner off 94 was tailed off behind Finnicky Filly here latest; better than that
runners.name: Redcliff Glen
runners.spotlight: Limerick handicap hurdle winner by a neck in October 2024 off 94; beaten joint-favourite at Thurles in October when eighth and tailed off behind Finnicky Filly here last month; capable of better than that.

runners.comment: Improved on h'cap debut to take fourth in Sept' but didn't build on that at Thurles latest
runners.name: Courtbrack Boy
runners.owner: Michael P Murray & Timothy R Murray
runners.spotlight: No show in three maiden hurdles but better effort on handicap debut at Listowel in September when fourth (2m, good to yielding); didn't build on that at Thurles latest when 32l behind the winner and showing tendency to jump left (2m, good to yielding); hard to trust now.

runners.comment: C&D winner in Dec' 2024; contender if ready to rock after almost a year off
runners.name: Kps Ladyofknock
runners.spotlight: Off the mark over C&D in December 2024 off 80 and still involved when carried out at Fairyhouse later that month; hampered by a loose horse when challenging at Down Royal in January last year, finishing third; contender if ready to rock after almost a year off.

runners.comment: PU in three of last five runs inc' in a point latest; blinkers on now but best watched
runners.name: Diamonds Diva
runners.spotlight: Winless from nine and pulled up in three of her last five, including in a point-to-point nine days ago; blinkers go on now but best watched.

runners.comment: Hit with a 7lb rise for her win here last time, but leading contender if in same form
runners.name: Finnicky Filly
runners.spotlight: Apparently well-named as her trainer noted she is difficult to train following her win over an extended 2m here last time (heavy) when seeing out the trip better than Wild Wild Wind in second; unplaced in 15 starts prior to that but had run some of her best races at this track; up 7lb for her win but a leading contender if in the same form.

runners.comment: Flat maiden and soundly beaten in opening three runs over hurdles; handicap debutant
runners.name: Crypto Crash
runners.spotlight: Modest Flat maiden for David Marnane; soundly beaten in opening three hurdle runs for current yard at big odds; makes handicap debut now and others preferred.

runners.comment: Triple-figure odds for all seven 2025 starts and ran like it; of little appeal
runners.name: Nobody
runners.spotlight: Triple-figure odds for all seven 2025 starts and ran like it; makes very little appeal.

runners.comment: Returned from a lengthy absence with two runs over fences; well h'capped on best form
runners.name: Atlantic Wonder
runners.spotlight: Twice a runner-up over hurdles in 2023 off higher marks; returned from an absence of over two years at Tramore in November when pulled up over fences after making a bad mistake at four out; didn't get a clear run and weakened into sixth at Naas (2m, heavy) last time; reverts to hurdles now and looks well handicapped on best form.

runners.comment: 4lb rise for runner-up finish behind Finnicky Filly here last time is harsh but in the mix
runners.name: Wild Wild Wind
runners.spotlight: Didn't distinguish herself in maidens but better in opening two handicaps, improving from a Sligo fourth (2m1f, good to yielding) to take the runner-up spot here last month behind Finnicky Filly (2m, heavy); a 4lb rise for that seems a little harsh but should be in the mix again.

runners.comment: Tailed off in opening m'dens and PU at Cork on return; handicap debutant
runners.name: Out Molls Gap
runners.spotlight: Tailed off in all three maiden hurdles last season and pulled up at Cork on seasonal return; makes handicap debut now but impossible to fancy on form.

runners.comment: Well behind Finnicky Filly and Wild Wild Wind here last time, so fair bit to find
runners.name: Fernhill Fling
runners.spotlight: Improved from moderate seasonal return at Limerick when a 20l seventh over an extended 2m here last month (heavy); well behind Finnicky Filly and Wild Wild Wind that day, so a fair bit to find.

runners.comment: No wins from 14 starts and yet to trouble the judge; PU here last month
runners.name: Avandra
runners.spotlight: No wins in 14 starts over hurdles and yet to trouble the judge; pulled up here early last month (2m3f, heavy) and in the rear throughout at Down Royal (2m1f, yielding) on St Stephen's Day.

runners.comment: Reserve; point winner has shown modest form under rules and tailed off on stable debut
runners.name: Kerlogue
runners.spotlight: First reserve; point-to-point winner has shown modest form under rules and was tailed off on stable debut at Cork last month.

runners.breeder: M Philippe Desmard Mme Alexia Desmard & Mme Cecile Desmard
runners.comment: Reserve; never involved in opening maiden hurdles and now makes handicap debut
runners.name: Loi Des Jeux
runners.spotlight: Second reserve; never involved in opening maiden hurdles and now makes handicap debut.

runners.comment: Reserve; minor encouragement in 4th at Limerick but didn't build on that on h'cap bow
runners.name: Koolio Kate
runners.spotlight: Third reserve; minor encouragement in fourth place in a Limerick maiden hurdle in November but failed to build on that on handicap debut at Fairyhouse (2m4f, soft) last month

runners.comment: Dual chase winner should strip fitter than opening run and is 12lb lower in this sphere
runners.name: Midweek Voices
runners.spotlight: Back-to-back chase winner early last year, but a runner-up finish in a maiden hurdle here (2m2f, soft to heavy) in April 2024 was his best effort over hurdles; should strip fitter for his opening run in a Cork novice handicap hurdle last month and is 12lb lower in this sphere.

runners.comment: Little impact in points and just okay m'den hurdle runs; mark doesn't look lenient
runners.name: Dontcavein
runners.spotlight: Made little impact in point-to-points and just okay efforts in maiden hurdles; opening mark doesn't look too lenient.

runners.comment: Beaten over 20l in last four completed starts; ran well in a m'den here in Feb'
runners.name: Arctic Piper
runners.spotlight: 0-12 under rules but was in the process of running a good race in a C&D maiden in February before falling at two out; visor is added to the tongue-tie now after being beaten over 20l in last four completed starts.

runners.comment: Point and beginner's chase winner; positive effort over hurdles in Oct' off 7lb higher
runners.name: Coffeys Forge
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point scorer was a beginners' chase winner for Gordon Elliott in May; winless from 15 tries over hurdles but it was a positive effort when a 3.75l third off 7lb higher in October; tailed off over fences at Thurles latest.

runners.comment: Dual point winner was tailed off in m'den hurdles but worth a market check for h'cap debut
runners.name: Mickey Hulie
runners.spotlight: Dual point-to-point winner ran creditably in a Listowel bumper on rules debut in September (2m4f, yielding) when third; tailed off in his last three maiden hurdles, but can do better in handicaps and worth a market check.

runners.comment: 4-59 over hurdles and ran a decent race over C&D in Dec'; lesser runs over fences recently
runners.name: The Little Yank
runners.spotlight: Record of 4-59 over hurdles; ran a decent race over C&D in December (heavy) when a 7l fifth off 1lb higher; has been chasing in his last two runs with little success, return to timber may help.

runners.comment: Second in a point and some okay runs in m'den hurdles; two middling runs this season
runners.name: Taketwotoone
runners.spotlight: Second in a point-to-point and ran okay in a couple of maiden hurdles; returned this season with two middling efforts; capable on best form.

runners.comment: Second in an Aug' m'den hurdle but questions after being PU in last two starts
runners.name: Toor Idaho
runners.spotlight: Best of nine hurdle runs was a second at Ballinrobe (good) over 2m6f in August; questions now after being pulled up in her last two runs.

runners.comment: Travelled strongly on h'cap debut before fading; not ruled out
runners.name: Hello Johnjoe
runners.spotlight: Ran her best race in a Tramore maiden hurdle in November when finishing fifth; upped in trip for her handicap debut at Fairyhouse, travelling strongly before fading from two out; not ruled out if staying better.

runners.comment: Made seasonal return at Limerick with 21l ninth; more needed
runners.name: Brown Boots
runners.spotlight: No wins from five starts to date; made seasonal return at Limerick with a 21l ninth; more needed.

runners.comment: Weakened into seventh at Limerick latest; big improvement needed
runners.name: DrumcLiff Bay
runners.spotlight: Weakened into a distant seventh at Limerick over an extended 2m5f late last month (soft to heavy); big improvement required.

runners.breeder: S C E A Haras Du Hoguenet E A R L Ecurie Prevost Baratte M
runners.comment: Beaten a long way in all starts to date; others more likely.
runners.name: Loulouless
runners.spotlight: Beaten a long way in maiden hurdle starts and hasn't improved markedly in two handicap runs; others more likely.

runners.comment: Two runs this year leave a lot to be desired and of little appeal on that basis
runners.name: Robindevidastar
runners.spotlight: 3-36 with his most recent win coming in November 2024 off 2lb higher; two recent runs have left a lot to be desired and makes little appeal.

runners.breeder: E A Bourke M R C V S
runners.comment: Huge odds for three m'den hurdle starts, and ran like it; impossible to fancy on form
runners.name: Mister Rockefeller
runners.spotlight: Huge odds for three maiden hurdle starts, and ran like it; impossible to fancy on form to date.

runners.breeder: His Highness The Aga Khans Studs S C
runners.comment: Winless over hurdles and yet to trouble the judge; 6.25l seventh latest was an improvement
runners.name: Sidiriya
runners.spotlight: Flat maiden winner is 0-11 over hurdles and yet to trouble the judge; best of recent efforts came over C&D last time when a 6.25l seventh (heavy); hood goes on now, but others preferred.
